gaming|TestSessions|SessionRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying each test session record.
gaming|TestSessions|StampMoment: A TIMESTAMP(6) capturing the exact date/time when the session was recorded.
gaming|TestSessions|DevScope: An enum (DevScope_enum) indicating the tested device category (e.g., Keyboard, Headset, Gamepad, Mouse, Controller).
gaming|TestSessions|CpuUsePct: A NUMERIC(5,2) showing CPU usage percentage during the test session.
gaming|TestSessions|MemUseMB: An INTEGER specifying memory usage in megabytes at the time of the test.
gaming|TestSessions|DriverStatus: An enum (DriverStability_enum) describing driver stability status (Stable, Beta, or Experimental).
gaming|TestSessions|FwUpDur: A SMALLINT indicating how many seconds/minutes it takes to complete a firmware update.
gaming|TestSessions|WlSignal: A NUMERIC(5,2) representing wireless signal strength (e.g., in dBm or relative scale).
gaming|TestSessions|BattLevel: A SMALLINT showing current battery percentage (0–100).
gaming|TestSessions|BattCapMah: An INTEGER specifying battery capacity in milliamp-hours (mAh).
gaming|TestSessions|BattLifeH: A NUMERIC(4,1) for the device’s remaining or estimated battery life in hours.
gaming|TestSessions|ChgTimeMin: A NUMERIC(5,2) indicating the number of minutes required for a full battery charge.
gaming|TestSessions|QChgFlag: A BOOLEAN (true/false) stating whether quick charge is supported by the device.
gaming|TestSessions|UsbPwrLine: A VARCHAR(25) field describing the USB power delivery or specification (e.g., 7.5W, 5W, 10W).
gaming|TestSessions|LatMs: A NUMERIC(5,2) measuring overall latency in milliseconds from user input to system response.
gaming|TestSessions|InpLagMs: A NUMERIC(5,2) capturing input lag (in ms) between the device and the system.
gaming|TestSessions|PollRateHz: A SMALLINT describing the device's polling rate in Hertz (times per second).
gaming|TestSessions|DbTimeMs: A NUMERIC(4,2) specifying the debounce time (in ms) for mechanical or electrical inputs.
gaming|TestSessions|RespTimeMs: A NUMERIC(4,2) indicating the device’s response time (in ms) after input is detected.
gaming|TestSessions|ClkRegMs: A NUMERIC(4,3) measuring how many milliseconds it takes for a click/button press to register.
gaming|Performance|PerfRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying each performance record.
gaming|Performance|PerfSessionRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing TestSessions(SessionRegistry) to link performance metrics to a specific session.
gaming|Performance|AccelMax: A SMALLINT indicating the maximum acceleration (in G or m/s²) the device sensor can handle.
gaming|Performance|SpeedIPS: A SMALLINT for maximum tracking speed in inches per second (IPS) for pointing devices.
gaming|Performance|LiftDistMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) describing the lift-off distance in millimeters, often relevant for mouse sensors.
gaming|Performance|AngSnap: A BOOLEAN stating whether angle snapping (prediction or correction) is enabled.
gaming|Performance|BtnTens: An enum (BtnTens_enum) describing button tension (Light, Medium, or Heavy).
gaming|Performance|ClkLat: A NUMERIC(3,2) measuring click latency (in ms) from actuation to system registration.
gaming|Performance|ClkDur: A BIGINT noting the rated click durability (e.g., number of clicks before failure).
gaming|Performance|ScrEncTyp: An enum (ScrollEncoder_enum) for the scroll wheel mechanism type (Mechanical, Optical, Magnetic).
gaming|Performance|ScrSteps: A SMALLINT for how many discrete 'clicks' or steps a full scroll wheel rotation has.
gaming|Performance|ScrAccy: A NUMERIC(4,1) reflecting the scroll wheel’s accuracy or consistency (on a relative scale).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|DevRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying the device identity record.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|DevSessionRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing TestSessions(SessionRegistry), linking the device to its test session.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|MakerName: A VARCHAR(50) naming the manufacturer or brand of the device.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|ModNum: A VARCHAR(50) specifying the model name or number of the device.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|FwVer: A VARCHAR(50) denoting the firmware version running on the device.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|ConnType: A VARCHAR(35) indicating how the device connects (e.g., Wireless 2.4GHz, Wired, Bluetooth, Hybrid).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|WlRangeM: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring the device’s wireless range in meters (if applicable).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|WlInterf: A VARCHAR(35) describing interference or constraints on the wireless connection (e.g., Low, High, Medium).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|WlChanHop: A BOOLEAN stating if the device automatically hops channels to avoid interference.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|WlLatVar: A NUMERIC(4,2) capturing variation in wireless latency (e.g., standard deviation).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|PwrIdleMw: An INTEGER specifying power consumption (in mW) when the device is idle.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|PwrActMw: An INTEGER indicating power consumption (in mW) under active usage.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|PwrRgbMw: An INTEGER showing additional power draw (in mW) attributed to any RGB lighting.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|BrdMemMB: A SMALLINT for onboard memory size (in MB) for storing profiles/macros.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|ProfCount: A SMALLINT specifying how many user profiles can be stored on the device.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|McRespTime: A NUMERIC(4,2) measuring the microcontroller’s response time (in ms) to inputs.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|McExecSpeed: A NUMERIC(4,2) describing microcontroller execution speed or frequency (possibly in MHz).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|McTimAcc: A NUMERIC(5,2) representing microcontroller timing accuracy (in percent or a relevant unit).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|DpiRes: An INTEGER for the sensor’s primary DPI resolution.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|DpiSteps: A SMALLINT listing how many DPI step increments the device supports.
gaming|DeviceIdentity|SensType: A VARCHAR(50) describing the sensor type (e.g., PMW3389, Optical, Laser, PAW3399).
gaming|DeviceIdentity|SensRes: An INTEGER indicating a secondary sensor resolution or specification (if distinct from DPI).
gaming|Mechanical|MechRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying the mechanical properties record.
gaming|Mechanical|MechPerfRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing Performance(PerfRegistry), linking mechanical specs to performance metrics.
gaming|Mechanical|MechDevRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing DeviceIdentity(DevRegistry), associating mechanical data with a specific device.
gaming|Mechanical|KeyForceG: A NUMERIC(5,2) describing actuation force (in grams) for keys or switches.
gaming|Mechanical|KeyTravMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) showing total travel distance (in mm) for keys or buttons.
gaming|Mechanical|SwtchVar: A VARCHAR(40) naming the specific switch variant (e.g., Membrane, Mechanical, Optical, Magnetic).
gaming|Mechanical|SwtchDur: A BIGINT indicating the rated switch durability (e.g., total actuations).
gaming|Mechanical|GhostKeys: A SMALLINT counting how many keys might exhibit ‘ghosting’ if pressed simultaneously.
gaming|Mechanical|KeyRollo: A VARCHAR(35) describing the rollover spec (e.g., 2KRO, 6KRO, NKRO).
gaming|Mechanical|SwtchCons: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring the consistency in switch actuation force or performance.
gaming|Mechanical|GhostEff: A NUMERIC(4,1) quantifying the effective impact of ghosting (on a scale or percentage).
gaming|Mechanical|KeyChatter: A NUMERIC(3,2) indicating key chatter or bounce (in ms or a relative measure).
gaming|Mechanical|ActPointMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) showing at what point (in mm) the key actuates from the top of its travel.
gaming|Mechanical|ResPointMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) specifying the reset point (in mm) where the switch deactivates on release.
gaming|Mechanical|TacBumpMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) measuring the tactile bump position (in mm) in a tactile switch.
gaming|Mechanical|TotTravMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) for the total travel distance (in mm) if fully bottomed out.
gaming|Mechanical|StabRattle: An enum (StabRattle_enum) indicating stabilizer rattle level (None, Minimal, Moderate).
gaming|Mechanical|StabType: A VARCHAR(30) naming the stabilizer type (e.g., PCB Mount, Screw-in, Plate Mount).
gaming|Mechanical|CapThkMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) for the keycap thickness (in mm).
gaming|Mechanical|CapMat: A VARCHAR(35) specifying the keycap material (ABS, PBT, etc.).
gaming|Mechanical|CapLegMeth: A VARCHAR(40) describing how the legends are applied (e.g., Double Shot, Dye Sub, Laser Etched).
gaming|Mechanical|KbdAngle: A SMALLINT indicating the built-in keyboard angle or tilt (in degrees).
gaming|Mechanical|WristFlag: A BOOLEAN stating whether a wrist rest is integrated or included.
gaming|Mechanical|PalmAngle: A SMALLINT measuring the palm rest angle (in degrees), if applicable.
gaming|Mechanical|ErgoRate: A SMALLINT providing an ergonomic rating (on a defined scale).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|AudRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying the audio/media properties record.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|AudDevRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing DeviceIdentity(DevRegistry), linking these audio/media specs to a device.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|AudPerfRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing Performance(PerfRegistry), associating audio/media data with performance metrics.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|SndLevelDb: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring sound output level in decibels from the device.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|SndSig: A VARCHAR(30) describing the sound signature (e.g., Silent, Thocky, Clicky, Linear).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|NoiseIsoDb: A SMALLINT for how many dB of noise isolation the device provides.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|AudLatMs: A NUMERIC(4,1) capturing audio latency (in ms) from signal to output.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|MicSenseDb: A NUMERIC(5,2) measuring microphone sensitivity in dB (e.g., dBV).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|MicFreqResp: A VARCHAR(50) specifying the microphone frequency response range (e.g., 20Hz–20kHz).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|SpkImpOhm: A SMALLINT indicating the speaker or driver impedance in ohms.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|SpkSenseDb: A SMALLINT specifying speaker sensitivity in decibels (dB SPL @ 1kHz).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|ThdPct: A NUMERIC(3,2) for total harmonic distortion (THD) as a percentage.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|FreqResp: A VARCHAR(50) describing the device’s frequency response specification (e.g., 20Hz–20kHz).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|DrvSzMm: A SMALLINT measuring the diameter (in mm) of the speaker or audio driver.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|SurrSnd: A VARCHAR(30) naming any surround sound technology (e.g., Stereo, 5.1, 7.1).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|EqCount: A SMALLINT counting available EQ profiles or presets.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|MicMon: A BOOLEAN indicating if mic monitoring (sidetone) is supported.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|NoiseCanc: An enum (NoiseCanc_enum) denoting the noise cancellation type (None, Passive, Active).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|BtVersion: A VARCHAR(35) referencing Bluetooth version (e.g., 4.0, 5.0, 5.1, 5.2) if applicable.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|BtRangeM: A SMALLINT specifying typical Bluetooth range in meters.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|BtLatMs: A NUMERIC(5,2) measuring Bluetooth audio latency (in ms).
gaming|AudioAndMedia|MultiDev: A BOOLEAN stating whether the device can connect to multiple endpoints simultaneously.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|AutoSlpMin: A SMALLINT specifying how many minutes pass before the device goes into auto-sleep mode.
gaming|AudioAndMedia|WakeMs: A NUMERIC(5,1) representing how many milliseconds it takes for the device to wake from sleep.
gaming|RGB|RgbRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying each RGB lighting record.
gaming|RGB|RgbMechRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing Mechanical(MechRegistry), associating RGB details with a mechanical record (e.g., a keyboard).
gaming|RGB|RgbAudRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing AudioAndMedia(AudRegistry), linking RGB details to audio/media data if necessary.
gaming|RGB|RgbBright: A SMALLINT indicating the RGB brightness level (on a predefined scale or percentage).
gaming|RGB|RgbColorAcc: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring color accuracy or uniformity (e.g., Delta E or similar scale).
gaming|RGB|RgbRfRate: A SMALLINT specifying the refresh rate (in Hz) at which the RGB lighting updates.
gaming|RGB|RgbModes: A VARCHAR(25) naming the different RGB lighting modes (e.g., 'Wave', 'Static', 'Breathing').
gaming|RGB|RgbZones: A SMALLINT counting how many independent zones or sections of RGB control the device has.
gaming|RGB|RgbColors: An INTEGER for the total number of distinct colors supported (e.g., 16.8 million).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|PhysRegistry: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying each physical durability record.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|PhysRgbRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing RGB(RgbRegistry), linking durability data to RGB hardware (often in keyboards or mice).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|PhysPerfRef: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing Performance(PerfRegistry), associating physical durability with overall performance metrics.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|WgtGram: A SMALLINT specifying the device’s weight in grams.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|WgtDist: A VARCHAR(30) describing weight distribution (e.g., 'Front Heavy', 'Back Heavy', 'Balanced').
gaming|PhysicalDurability|CableGram: A SMALLINT measuring the cable’s weight in grams (if relevant).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|CableDrag: A VARCHAR(25) characterizing the cable’s drag or friction level (e.g., 'Moderate', 'Minimal', 'Significant').
gaming|PhysicalDurability|FeetMat: A VARCHAR(25) naming the material of the device’s feet/skates (e.g., Glass, Virgin PTFE, PTFE, Ceramic).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|FeetThkMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) indicating thickness (in mm) of the device’s feet/skates.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|GlideCons: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring gliding consistency or friction uniformity (relative scale).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|FricStatic: A NUMERIC(3,2) specifying static friction coefficient or rating.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|FricKinetic: A NUMERIC(3,2) specifying kinetic friction coefficient or rating.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|SurfCompat: A VARCHAR(25) indicating the recommended or tested surface compatibility (e.g., Cloth Preferred, Hard Pad Preferred, Universal).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|GripSty: A VARCHAR(30) describing the handle/grip style (e.g., Palm, Hybrid, Fingertip, Claw).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|GripCoat: A VARCHAR(30) naming the grip coating type (must match GripCoat_enum if relevant).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|GripDur: A SMALLINT specifying approximate grip durability or rating (e.g., hours or a scale).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|SweatRes: A VARCHAR(30) detailing sweat resistance or finish claim (e.g., Low, Medium, High).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|TempRes: An enum (TempRes_enum) describing the temperature resistance level (Standard, Premium, Enhanced).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|HumidRes: An enum (HumidRes_enum) indicating humidity resistance level (Standard, Premium, Enhanced).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|DustRes: A VARCHAR(30) referencing dust ingress rating or claim (e.g., IPX1, IPX2, IPX3, IPX0).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|WaterRes: A VARCHAR(35) referencing water ingress protection (e.g., IPX1, IPX3, IPX0, IPX2).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|ImpRes: A VARCHAR(30) describing impact resistance (e.g., Standard, Military Grade, Enhanced).
gaming|PhysicalDurability|DropHtM: A NUMERIC(3,1) measuring the tested or guaranteed drop height in meters.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|BendForce: A SMALLINT indicating how much force (in N or a relative scale) is needed for noticeable bending.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|TwistDeg: A SMALLINT specifying the angle (in degrees) at which twisting becomes significant or detrimental.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|CableBend: An INTEGER showing the tested cable bend cycles or durability count.
gaming|PhysicalDurability|UsbConnDur: An INTEGER representing how many connect-disconnect cycles the USB port can handle before failure.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|InteractReg: A VARCHAR(20) primary key uniquely identifying each interaction/control record.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|InteractPhy: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing PhysicalDurability(PhysRegistry), linking control features to the physical build.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|InteractDev: A VARCHAR(20) foreign key referencing DeviceIdentity(DevRegistry), connecting input/interactivity data to a specific device.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|AmbLight: A BOOLEAN showing whether ambient light sensors are present and used for adaptive brightness.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|TempSense: A BOOLEAN indicating if the device has a temperature sensor to track environmental or internal heat.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|AccelSense: A BOOLEAN stating if accelerometers are included for motion detection.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|GyroSense: A BOOLEAN indicating the presence of gyroscopes for orientation or tilt detection.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|HapFeed: A VARCHAR(30) describing the haptic feedback system (e.g., Basic, Advanced).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|HapStr: A SMALLINT representing the maximum intensity or strength of the haptic feedback.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|VibModes: A SMALLINT counting how many vibration patterns or modes are available.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|ForceFeed: A VARCHAR(35) naming the force feedback type or system (e.g., Advanced, Basic).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|TrigRes: A SMALLINT for trigger resistance levels or steps (on controllers with adaptive triggers).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|TrigTravMm: A NUMERIC(3,1) describing trigger travel distance in millimeters.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|JoyDead: A NUMERIC(4,2) specifying the joystick dead zone (as a ratio or percentage).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|JoyPrec: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring joystick precision or resolution (e.g., in a scale from 0-100).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|BtnSpcMm: A NUMERIC(4,1) indicating spacing (in mm) between buttons (e.g., on a controller face).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|BtnSzMm: A NUMERIC(4,1) describing the physical size (in mm) of face buttons or triggers.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|DpadVar: A VARCHAR(30) naming the D-pad style/type (e.g., Hybrid, Standard, Floating).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|DpadAcc: A NUMERIC(4,1) measuring D-pad accuracy on a scale or in a test metric.
gaming|InteractionAndControl|AStickVar: A VARCHAR(30) describing the analog stick construction/type (e.g., Standard, Magnetic, Hall Effect).
gaming|InteractionAndControl|DriftRes: A NUMERIC(4,1) reflecting drift resistance or detection in the analog stick, measured on a scale or percentage.
